awd_abstract_narration:
The NSF-ARMI|BioFabUSA Workshop: Facilitating Advanced Tissue Manufacturing, will be held in Manchester, NH during the summer of 2023. The workshop focuses on state-of-the-art tissue fabrication technology and identifies grand challenges and opportunities for future work in this field. The workshop addresses the mission of NSF, which has been increasingly committed to integrating the engineering sciences with the life sciences, encouraging research and development in multidisciplinary areas, educating the next generation of young scientists, and translating cutting edge science to solutions for current and future challenges. 

The workshop will focus on converting manual processes for tissue manufacturing to protocols that can be implemented in fully automated and closed tissue manufacturing environment. It will provide a forum for industrial practitioners and academic researchers in the tissue manufacturing space to interact and create productive networks. It will also provide a demonstration of the integrated Design-Build-Test-Learn (DBTL) capabilities of the ARMI/BioFabUSA tissue manufacturing facility, as well as an explanation of how those facilities might be accessed.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

por.por_cntn:
This NSF workshop was an important part of the Annual Meeting in the Millyard (MIM) happening in Manchester, NH each year. As a highlight, two main focuses were followed:

(1) Engage the local and the international biomanufacturing ecosystem, that was ranging across Industry, Academia, as well as the clinical and the non-profit worlds. Numerous open discussions were exposing various state of-the-art technologies in the field. Discussion groups were formed to assess the major challenges and examine possible solutions to address them. Numerous panels with Subject-Matters-Experts exposed their innovative technology and approaches, all were available for questions fostering an interactive atmosphere. 

(2) Expand Education, Dissemination and outreach. A special emphasis was on Workforce development, an aspect that is paramount to sustain and ultimately drive the nascent and expanding field of biomanufacturing.

The exchanges and interactions led to several new collaborations between members of the ecosystem, enhancing the ever-growing capabilities of this pioneer field.

This NSF workshop was part of a major effort that is increasing awareness and interest for the biomanufacturing world at the national and international levels.

Most events were recorded, and all the Video recordings of the various events are available on the ARMI website for viewing for free.

https://digitalassets.armiusa.org/share/0CC408CB-28CA-45B6-BB6C0E23762AEE81/

 


Last Modified: 01/27/2025
Modified by: Thomas Bollenbach
